Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a solo home run in the 4th inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets won seven of 10 games on the three-city jaunt and returned home back within a game of the Braves — who lost to the Phillies on Sunday night — for the final NL wild-card spot
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sean Manaea was dominant, allowing two hits and walking two with five strikeouts over seven shutout innings
Others: The White Sox established a franchise record on this day with their 107th loss and remain on pace to supplant the 1962 Mets (who lost 120 games) as the worst team in MLB history
